memory_read.name: memory_read
memory_read.description: Read bytes from a memory address in the target process.
memory_read.help: Reads raw bytes from the specified memory address. Returns hex-encoded bytes. The address can be specified as a decimal or hexadecimal string.

memory_write.name: memory_write
memory_write.description: Write bytes to a memory address in the target process.
memory_write.help: Writes raw bytes to the specified memory address. Bytes should be hex-encoded. The memory protection will be temporarily changed if needed.

memory_search.name: memory_search
memory_search.description: Search memory for an exact value.
memory_search.help: Searches all readable memory regions for a specific value. Supports various data types including integers, floats, and strings.

examples.expected: List of addresses containing the value

memory_search_pattern.name: memory_search_pattern
memory_search_pattern.description: Search memory for an AOB (Array of Bytes) pattern with wildcards.
memory_search_pattern.help: Searches memory for a byte pattern. Use ?? for wildcard bytes. Useful for finding code patterns that may vary slightly.

examples.expected: List of addresses matching the pattern

memory_regions.name: memory_regions
memory_regions.description: List all memory regions with protection flags.
memory_regions.help: Enumerates all memory regions in the target process, showing base address, size, protection flags, and mapped file (if any).

examples.expected: List of memory regions with details

module_list.name: module_list
module_list.description: List all loaded modules in the target process.
module_list.help: Enumerates all loaded DLLs and the main executable, showing base address, size, and full path.

examples.expected: List of modules with base addresses and paths

module_exports.name: module_exports
module_exports.help: Enumerates all exported functions from a specified module. Shows function name, ordinal, and address.

module_imports.name: module_imports
module_imports.help: Enumerates all imported functions for a specified module. Shows source DLL, function name, and IAT address.

string_list.name: string_list
string_list.help: Scans a module's data sections for ASCII and Unicode strings. Useful for finding configuration, messages, and other text data.

symbol_resolve.name: symbol_resolve
symbol_resolve.help: Resolves a function or variable name to its address. Can use module!function syntax or just function name to search all modules.

disasm_at.name: disasm_at
disasm_at.description: Disassemble instructions at a specific address.
disasm_at.help: Disassembles a specified number of instructions starting at the given address. Shows address, bytes, mnemonic, and operands.

disasm_function.name: disasm_function
disasm_function.help: Disassembles instructions starting at the given address until a RET instruction is encountered. Useful for analyzing entire functions.

decompile.name: decompile
decompile.description: Decompile a function to pseudo-C code (Hex-Rays style).
decompile.help: Analyzes the assembly code at the given address and generates human-readable pseudo-C code similar to IDA Pro's Hex-Rays decompiler. The output includes variable inference, control flow reconstruction (if/else, loops, switch), and function call identification. Supports different output styles: 'c' for standard C-like output, 'simplified' for high-level overview, and 'verbose' for detailed annotations.

examples.expected: Pseudo-C code representation of the function
Pseudo-C code with function named ProcessData
Detailed pseudo-C with register mappings and comments

script_load.name: script_load
script_load.description: Load a script from file or inline code for Frida-style hooking.
script_load.help: Loads a JavaScript/Lua script that can create hooks with onEnter/onLeave callbacks. Scripts can export RPC functions for remote calling. Supports hot-reload.

script_unload.name: script_unload
script_unload.help: Unloads a previously loaded script and removes all its hooks and RPC exports.

script_reload.name: script_reload
script_reload.description: Hot-reload a script (unload and reload from source).
script_reload.help: Reloads a script from its original source. Useful for development when making changes to script files.

script_list.name: script_list
script_list.description: List all loaded scripts with their status.
script_list.help: Shows all currently loaded scripts with their IDs, names, source paths, and status.

script_status.name: script_status
script_status.description: Get detailed status of a specific script.
script_status.help: Shows detailed information about a script including hooks created, RPC exports, and execution statistics.

hook_create.name: hook_create
hook_create.description: Create a hook at an address with Frida-style callbacks.
hook_create.help: Creates an inline hook at the specified address. Supports onEnter (called when function is entered), onLeave (called when function returns), and onException callbacks. Callbacks have access to registers, arguments, return value, and can modify them.

hook_remove.name: hook_remove
hook_remove.help: Removes a previously created hook and restores the original code.

hook_enable.name: hook_enable
hook_enable.help: Temporarily enables or disables a hook without removing it. Useful for toggling hooks during analysis.

hook_list.name: hook_list
hook_list.help: Shows all currently active hooks with their IDs, addresses, owning scripts, and enabled status.

rpc_list.name: rpc_list
rpc_list.description: List all exported RPC functions from scripts.
rpc_list.help: Shows all RPC functions that have been exported by loaded scripts, available for remote calling.

rpc_call.name: rpc_call
rpc_call.description: Call an RPC function exported by a script.
rpc_call.help: Calls a remote procedure that was exported by a loaded script. Arguments are passed as an array.

agent_status.name: agent_status
agent_status.description: Get the status of the ghost-agent connection.
agent_status.help: Returns information about the current agent connection including target process, PID, and connection status.

agent_reconnect.name: agent_reconnect
agent_reconnect.description: Disconnect and reconnect to the ghost-agent.
agent_reconnect.help: Closes the current agent connection and attempts to reconnect. Useful after rebuilding the agent DLL or if the connection becomes stale.

action_last.name: action_last
action_last.description: Get details of the last executed action.
action_last.help: Returns information about the most recently executed tool call including tool name, arguments, result, and timing.

action_verify.name: action_verify
action_verify.description: Verify the last action completed as expected.
action_verify.help: Checks if the last action met specified criteria. Useful for scripted verification of tool results.

mcp_capabilities.name: mcp_capabilities
mcp_capabilities.description: List all available tools organized by category.
mcp_capabilities.help: Returns a structured list of all available MCP tools, optionally filtered by category. Categories include: memory, module, debug, disasm, script, session, process, meta.

mcp_documentation.name: mcp_documentation
mcp_documentation.description: Get detailed documentation and examples for a tool.
mcp_documentation.help: Returns comprehensive documentation for a specific tool including description, usage details, examples, and related tools.

mcp_version.name: mcp_version
mcp_version.description: Get server version and build information.
mcp_version.help: Returns version information about the Ghost-MCP server including version number, protocol version, and build details.

mcp_health.name: mcp_health
mcp_health.description: Check health of all Ghost-MCP components.
mcp_health.help: Performs a health check on the MCP server, agent connection, script engine, and IPC. Returns detailed status for each component and diagnostic messages.

session_info.name: session_info
session_info.help: Returns information about the current debugging session including attached process, architecture, script count, and other statistics.

session_attach.name: session_attach
session_attach.description: Attach to a process by name or PID.
session_attach.help: Attaches the ghost-agent to a running process. Can specify either PID or process name.

session_detach.name: session_detach
session_detach.help: Detaches the ghost-agent from the currently attached process. All hooks are removed and the process continues normally.

process_list.name: process_list
process_list.description: List running processes with optional filter.
process_list.help: Enumerates running processes on the system. Can filter by name substring or architecture.

process_spawn.name: process_spawn
process_spawn.description: Spawn a new process with optional early injection support.
process_spawn.help: Starts a new process. Can start suspended for early injection before any target code runs. Optionally injects the ghost-agent DLL after spawn.

process_resume.name: process_resume
process_resume.help: Resumes execution of a process that was started in suspended state.

process_terminate.name: process_terminate
process_terminate.help: Terminates a running process. Can use graceful or forced termination.

scan_new.name: scan_new
scan_new.description: Create a new scan session with specified options.
scan_new.help: Creates a new Cheat Engine-style scan session. Configure value type, comparison mode, alignment, and region filters. Returns a scan_id for use with subsequent scan operations. Supports multiple simultaneous scan sessions.

examples.description: Create session for exact i32 scan
Create session for unknown initial scan

scan_first.name: scan_first
scan_first.description: Perform the initial scan to find all matching values.
scan_first.help: Executes the first scan using the options configured in scan_new. For exact scans, provide the value to search for. For unknown initial scans, all values are captured for later filtering. Returns scan statistics including result count and timing.

scan_next.name: scan_next
scan_next.description: Perform iterative scan to filter existing results.
scan_next.help: Filters the current scan results based on a comparison. Supports: exact (new value), changed, unchanged, increased, decreased, greater, less, sameasfirst, sameasprevious, fuzzy. This is the core of iterative scanning - repeat with different comparisons to narrow down results.

scan_results.name: scan_results
scan_results.help: Retrieves the current scan results. Results include address, current value, previous value (if iterative), and first scan value. Use offset and limit for pagination on large result sets.

scan_count.name: scan_count
scan_count.description: Get the current result count for a scan session.
scan_count.help: Returns just the count of results without the full result data. Useful for checking how many results remain after filtering.

scan_progress.name: scan_progress
scan_progress.description: Get real-time progress of the current scan operation.
scan_progress.help: Returns detailed progress information for a running scan including regions scanned, bytes processed, results found so far, and elapsed time. Useful for monitoring long-running scans.

scan_cancel.name: scan_cancel
scan_cancel.help: Cancels a running scan operation. Partial results up to the cancellation point are preserved.

scan_close.name: scan_close
scan_close.description: Close a scan session and free resources.
scan_close.help: Closes an active scan session and frees all associated memory. Use when done with a scan to clean up resources.

scan_list.name: scan_list
scan_list.help: Returns a list of all active scan sessions with their IDs, options, result counts, and status.

scan_export.name: scan_export
scan_export.description: Export scan results to JSON, CSV, or Cheat Engine XML format.
scan_export.help: Exports the current scan results to a portable format. JSON preserves all data, CSV is spreadsheet-compatible, and XML is compatible with Cheat Engine tables.

scan_import.name: scan_import
scan_import.description: Import scan results from JSON data.
scan_import.help: Imports previously exported scan results into a session. Use with JSON format from scan_export.

exec_resolve.name: exec_resolve
exec_resolve.description: Resolve a function address by module and function name.
exec_resolve.help: Uses GetProcAddress to resolve the address of a function exported by a loaded module. The module will be loaded if not already present. Returns the resolved address that can be used with exec_call.

exec_call.name: exec_call
exec_call.description: Call a function at a specific address with arguments.
exec_call.help: Calls a function at the specified address with the provided arguments. Supports various calling conventions. For x64, the first 4 arguments are passed in RCX, RDX, R8, R9. Returns the function's return value.

examples.description: Call with arguments in new thread

exec_call_api.name: exec_call_api
exec_call_api.description: Call a Windows API function by name.
exec_call_api.help: Convenience function that resolves and calls a Windows API function in one step. Combines exec_resolve and exec_call functionality.

exec_shellcode.name: exec_shellcode
exec_shellcode.description: Execute shellcode in the target process.
exec_shellcode.help: Allocates RWX memory, copies shellcode, and executes it using the specified method. Supports various execution methods including direct call, new thread, APC injection, and thread hijacking. Returns the shellcode's return value.

exec_alloc.name: exec_alloc
exec_alloc.description: Allocate executable memory in the target process.
exec_alloc.help: Allocates a block of memory with the specified protection. Useful for staging shellcode or code patches. Remember to free with exec_free when done.

exec_free.name: exec_free
exec_free.help: Frees memory previously allocated with exec_alloc. Pass the address returned by exec_alloc.

exec_write.name: exec_write
exec_write.help: Writes hex-encoded data to a memory address. Temporarily changes memory protection if needed. Useful for patching code or staging shellcode.

cave_find.name: cave_find
cave_find.help: Searches for unused executable space (code caves) that can be used for placing hooks or trampolines. Looks for sequences of NOPs or zeros in executable regions.

cave_alloc.name: cave_alloc
cave_alloc.description: Allocate and reserve a code cave for use.
cave_alloc.help: Marks a code cave as in-use to prevent conflicts. Returns an ID for tracking. Use cave_free when done.

cave_free.name: cave_free
cave_free.description: Free a previously allocated code cave.
cave_free.help: Releases a code cave previously reserved with cave_alloc, making it available for reuse.

cave_list.name: cave_list
cave_list.help: Returns a list of all code caves currently reserved for use, including their addresses, sizes, and descriptions.

syscall_number.name: syscall_number
syscall_number.description: Get the syscall number for an ntdll function.
syscall_number.help: Extracts the syscall number from an ntdll function's stub. Useful for direct syscall invocation to bypass user-mode hooks.

syscall_invoke.name: syscall_invoke
syscall_invoke.description: Invoke a syscall directly (bypasses user-mode hooks).
syscall_invoke.help: Executes a syscall directly using the syscall instruction, bypassing any ntdll hooks. Requires the syscall number from syscall_number. Note: This is an advanced feature.

remote_thread.name: remote_thread
remote_thread.description: Create a remote thread in another process.
remote_thread.help: Creates a thread in a target process to execute code at the specified address. Useful for DLL injection or executing shellcode in another process.

remote_apc.name: remote_apc
remote_apc.description: Queue an APC to a thread in another process.
remote_apc.help: Queues an Asynchronous Procedure Call to a thread in another process. The APC will execute when the thread enters an alertable wait state. More stealthy than CreateRemoteThread.

command_batch.name: command_batch
command_batch.description: Execute multiple commands as a batch sequence with optional conditions.
command_batch.help: Executes a sequence of commands in order, with support for conditions, error handling, and transactions. Commands can reference previous command results via labels. Useful for complex multi-step operations like 'find value, set breakpoint, wait for hit, read registers'.

examples.expected: Sequence result with individual command results

command_history.name: command_history
command_history.help: Retrieves a history of previously executed commands with their arguments and results. Useful for replaying commands or reviewing what was done during a session.

command_replay.name: command_replay
command_replay.description: Replay a command from history by ID.
command_replay.help: Re-executes a command from history, optionally with modified arguments. Useful for repeating operations or testing variations.

event_subscribe.name: event_subscribe
event_subscribe.description: Subscribe to agent events (breakpoints, exceptions, memory changes, hooks).
event_subscribe.help: Creates a subscription to receive events from the agent. Events are buffered and can be polled using event_poll. Useful for monitoring breakpoint hits, exceptions, hook triggers, and other async events.

event_unsubscribe.name: event_unsubscribe
event_unsubscribe.help: Cancels an event subscription and clears any buffered events.

event_poll.name: event_poll
event_poll.description: Poll for buffered events from a subscription.
event_poll.help: Retrieves events that have been buffered for a subscription. By default, events are cleared after reading. Returns event details including type, timestamp, and context (registers, stack, etc.).

event_list.name: event_list
event_list.help: Returns a list of all active event subscriptions with their configuration and buffer status.

ai_summarize.name: ai_summarize
ai_summarize.description: Generate an AI-friendly summary of the last operation or specified data.
ai_summarize.help: Creates a structured summary suitable for AI consumption, including key findings, observations, and suggested next steps. Useful for understanding complex results.

ai_diff.name: ai_diff
ai_diff.description: Generate a diff report comparing two states.
ai_diff.help: Compares two states (memory, registers, modules, etc.) and produces a structured diff report showing additions, removals, and modifications.

ai_explain_error.name: ai_explain_error
ai_explain_error.description: Get a detailed AI-friendly explanation of an error.
ai_explain_error.help: Provides a comprehensive explanation of an error, including possible causes, suggested fixes, and relevant documentation links.

debug_session_create.name: debug_session_create
debug_session_create.description: Create a new AI-assisted debugging session.
debug_session_create.help: Creates a conversational debugging session that tracks findings, hypotheses, and progress toward a goal. The session maintains context across multiple tool calls.

arguments.name: Find health value
arguments.goal: Locate the player health variable in memory

debug_session_info.name: debug_session_info
debug_session_info.description: Get current debugging session state and findings.
debug_session_info.help: Returns the complete state of a debugging session including findings, hypotheses, recommended next steps, and context.

debug_session_update.name: debug_session_update
debug_session_update.description: Update the debugging session with new findings or hypotheses.
debug_session_update.help: Adds new findings, hypotheses, or context to a debugging session. Findings are observations made during analysis. Hypotheses are theories to test.

debug_session_close.name: debug_session_close
debug_session_close.help: Closes a debugging session and optionally saves the findings. The session data remains available for reference.

debug_session_list.name: debug_session_list
debug_session_list.help: Returns a list of all debugging sessions (active and closed) with their status and summary.

ai_recommend_breakpoints.name: ai_recommend_breakpoints
ai_recommend_breakpoints.description: Get AI recommendations for breakpoint locations based on analysis goal.
ai_recommend_breakpoints.help: Analyzes the target module and suggests optimal breakpoint locations based on the analysis goal. Considers imports, exports, strings, and code patterns.

examples.expected: List of recommended breakpoint addresses with rationale

ai_analyze_vulnerability.name: ai_analyze_vulnerability
ai_analyze_vulnerability.description: Analyze a code location for potential vulnerabilities.
ai_analyze_vulnerability.help: Performs static analysis around the specified address looking for common vulnerability patterns like buffer overflows, format strings, use-after-free, etc.

ai_learn_pattern.name: ai_learn_pattern
ai_learn_pattern.description: Learn and save a pattern from user actions for future reference.
ai_learn_pattern.help: Saves a pattern (code sequence, behavior, data structure, etc.) that was discovered during analysis. Patterns can be recalled later for similar analyses.

ai_patterns_list.name: ai_patterns_list
ai_patterns_list.help: Returns all saved patterns, optionally filtered by type. Patterns can be used to recognize similar code or behavior in future analyses.

trace_session_create.name: trace_session_create
trace_session_create.description: Create a new API call trace session.
trace_session_create.help: Creates a trace session for capturing Win32 API calls. Configure buffer size, stack capture depth, and whether to capture call durations and output parameters. Similar to Rohitab API Monitor.

trace_control.name: trace_control
trace_control.description: Control trace capture with a consolidated action (start, stop, pause, resume).
trace_control.help: Maps consolidated trace actions to the appropriate session control commands. Use it to start, stop, pause, or resume an existing trace_session.

trace_session_start.name: trace_session_start
trace_session_start.description: Start capturing API calls for a session.
trace_session_start.help: Begins API call capture. Hooks are installed for APIs matching the session's filter and loaded API packs.

trace_session_stop.name: trace_session_stop
trace_session_stop.help: Stops API call capture and removes hooks. Captured events remain in the buffer for retrieval.

trace_session_pause.name: trace_session_pause
trace_session_pause.help: Pauses capture without removing hooks. Can be resumed quickly.

trace_session_resume.name: trace_session_resume
trace_session_resume.help: Resumes capture for a paused session.

trace_session_close.name: trace_session_close
trace_session_close.description: Close and cleanup a trace session.
trace_session_close.help: Stops capture, removes hooks, and frees all resources for the session.

trace_session_list.name: trace_session_list
trace_session_list.help: Returns all trace sessions with their current state and statistics.

trace_session_info.name: trace_session_info
trace_session_info.description: Get detailed information about a trace session.
trace_session_info.help: Returns comprehensive session info including state, configuration, statistics, and installed hooks.

trace_events.name: trace_events
trace_events.help: Retrieves captured API call events with full argument decoding. Supports pagination for large result sets.

trace_events_clear.name: trace_events_clear
trace_events_clear.help: Clears all events from the session's ring buffer without stopping capture.

trace_stats.name: trace_stats
trace_stats.help: Returns per-API call counts, average durations, success/failure rates, and per-module/thread breakdown.

trace_queue_stats.name: trace_queue_stats
trace_queue_stats.help: Returns queue depth, total captured, dropped events, and events per second rate.

trace_filter_set.name: trace_filter_set
trace_filter_set.description: Set filter for a trace session.
trace_filter_set.help: Configure which APIs to capture using include/exclude patterns for API names, modules, and threads. Supports prefix:, suffix:, contains:, regex: patterns.

trace_preset_list.name: trace_preset_list
trace_preset_list.help: Returns built-in and custom filter presets. Built-in presets include File Operations, Network Operations, Registry Operations, and Errors Only.

trace_preset_apply.name: trace_preset_apply
trace_preset_apply.description: Apply a filter preset to a session.
trace_preset_apply.help: Applies a saved filter preset to the session, replacing any existing filter.

trace_preset_create.name: trace_preset_create
trace_preset_create.help: Saves a filter configuration as a named preset for reuse.

trace_preset_delete.name: trace_preset_delete
trace_preset_delete.help: Deletes a user-created preset. Built-in presets cannot be deleted.

trace_pack_list.name: trace_pack_list
trace_pack_list.help: Returns loaded API definition packs. Built-in packs include kernel32, user32, ntdll, ws2_32, and advapi32.

trace_pack_info.name: trace_pack_info
trace_pack_info.description: Get detailed info about an API pack.
trace_pack_info.help: Returns pack details including function definitions, struct definitions, and enum definitions.

trace_pack_load.name: trace_pack_load
trace_pack_load.description: Load a custom API definition pack.
trace_pack_load.help: Loads API definitions from a JSON file. Custom packs extend tracing to additional APIs.

trace_pack_unload.name: trace_pack_unload
trace_pack_unload.help: Unloads a custom API pack. Built-in packs cannot be unloaded.

trace_hooks_list.name: trace_hooks_list
trace_hooks_list.description: List installed API hooks for a session.
trace_hooks_list.help: Returns all installed hooks with their status, addresses, and call counts.
